Detailed Description

This class is used to represent a plane in 3 dimensional space.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum PlaneEq::ShouldNormalise

Enumerator:
SHOULD_NORMALISE 
SHOULD_NOT_NORMALISE 

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

PlaneEq::PlaneEq (  ) 

The default constructor.

If this constructor is used, care should be taken that the plane equation is set up later.

PlaneEq::PlaneEq ( const Vector3 &  normal,
const float  d 
)

This constructor takes a normal to the plane and the value of the dot product between this normal and a point on the plane.

Parameters:
normal The normal to the plane. (The plane has sideness). The normal should point out of the front of the plane.
d The dot product between the input normal and any point on the plane.

PlaneEq::PlaneEq ( const Vector3 &  point,
const Vector3 &  normal 
)

This constructor takes a point on the plane and a normal to the plane.

Parameters:
point Any point on the plane.
normal The normal to the plane. (The plane has sideness). The normal should point out of the front of the plane.

PlaneEq::PlaneEq ( const Vector3 &  p0,
const Vector3 &  p1,
const Vector3 &  p2,
ShouldNormalise  normalise = SHOULD_NORMALISE 
)

This constructor takes three points that lie on the plane.

The points should be in a clockwise order when looked at from the front side of the plane. The points must not be colinear.

Parameters:
p0 A point on the plane.
p1 A point on the plane.
p2 A point on the plane.
normalise If true, the normal is normalised.

Member Function Documentation

void PlaneEq::basis ( Vector3 &  xdir,
Vector3 &  ydir 
) const

This function returns the x and y directions for the parameterised basis of the given plane.

float PlaneEq::d (  )  const

This method returns the constant in the plane equation.

This value is equal to the dot product of this plane's normal with any point on the plane.

float PlaneEq::distanceTo ( const Vector3 &  point  )  const

This method returns the distance of the input point from the plane.

If the input point is behind the plane a negative value is returned.

Parameters:
point The point to find the distance from the plane.
Returns:
The distance from the input point to the nearest point on the plane.

void PlaneEq::init ( const Vector3 &  point,
const Vector3 &  normal 
)

This constructor takes a point on the plane and a normal to the plane.

Parameters:
point Any point on the plane.
normal The normal to the plane. (The plane has sideness). The normal should point out of the front of the plane.

void PlaneEq::init ( const Vector3 &  p0,
const Vector3 &  p1,
const Vector3 &  p2,
ShouldNormalise  normalise = SHOULD_NORMALISE 
)

This method initialises the plane equation so that the input points lie on it.

The points should be in a clockwise order when looked at from the front of the plane. The points must not be colinear.

Parameters:
p0 A point on the plane.
p1 A point on the plane.
p2 A point on the plane.
normalise If true, the normal is normalised.

LineEq PlaneEq::intersect ( const PlaneEq &  slice  )  const

Plane intersection function.

The line is defined in the 'this' plane.

Vector3 PlaneEq::intersectRay ( const Vector3 &  source,
const Vector3 &  dir 
) const

This method intersects a ray from 'source' going in direction 'dir' with this plane.

float PlaneEq::intersectRayHalf ( const Vector3 &  source,
float  normalDotDir 
) const

This method intersects a ray from 'source' going in a given direction with this plane.

The second argument is the precalculated dot product the plane's normal with the direction.

Returns:
amount to multiply direction by from source to get to the plane

float PlaneEq::intersectRayHalfNoCheck ( const Vector3 &  source,
float  oneOverNormalDotDir 
) const

This method intersects a ray from 'source' going in a given direction with this plane.

The second argument is one over the precalculated dot product the plane's normal with the direction.

Returns:
amount to multiply direction by from source to get to the plane

bool PlaneEq::isInFrontOf ( const Vector3 &  point  )  const

This method returns whether or not the input point is in front of the plane, allowing for a small buffer zone.

Returns:
True if the input point is in front of the plane, otherwise false.

bool PlaneEq::isInFrontOfExact ( const Vector3 &  point  )  const

This method returns whether or not the input point is in front of the plane.

Returns:
True if the input point is in front of the plane, otherwise false.

const Vector3 & PlaneEq::normal (  )  const

This method returns the normal of the plane.

The normal has unit length.

Vector3 PlaneEq::param ( const Vector2 &  param  )  const

This function finds the point defined by the 'point' param on the given plane.

It should be a method of PlaneEq.

Vector2 PlaneEq::project ( const Vector3 &  point  )  const

This function finds the param for the given point in the plane's basis.

void PlaneEq::setAlwaysVisible (  ) 

This method sets this plane so that it is always visible.

This is related to back-face culling.

void PlaneEq::setHidden (  ) 

This method sets this plane to be hidden.

This is related to back-face culling.

float PlaneEq::y ( float  x,
float  z 
) const

This method return the y coordinate of the plane for the input x and z coordinates.

Parameters:
x The x-coordinate of the point to find.
z The z-coordinate of the point to find.
Returns:
The y-coordinate of the point on the plane with the input x and z coordinates.
Warning:
This method should not be called on a plane that is parallel to the y axis.
